body:
Comment 6: 
The intent is that Anonymous is true for embedded fields.  The name of a field declared
with a name of "_" is simply "_".  You can't refer to that field in a program, but that
doesn't mean it doesn't have a name.

I agree that it would be better to have a name other than Anonymous for embedded fields.
 But the Go 1 guarantee means that we can't change this, and it's not all that bad.  So
I think this is a documentation issue: we should provide better documentation for the
Anonymous field of reflect.StructField.
_Labels changed: added **priority-later**, **documentation**, removed **priority-triage**._ _Status changed to **Accepted**._
